notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 4.11.35 is now available with
updates to packages and images that fix several bugs.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 4.11.35. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2023:1650

All OpenShift Container Platform 4.11 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images when they are available in the appropriate
release channel. To check for available updates, use the OpenShift Console
or the CLI oc command. Instructions for upgrading a cluster are available
at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.11/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

document.title: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.11.35 packages and security update

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. The language package for go language can panic due to an out-of-bounds read when an incorrectly formatted language tag is being parsed. This flaw allows an attacker to cause applications using this package to parse untrusted input data to crash, leading to a denial of service of the affected component.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: out-of-bounds read in golang.org/x/text/language leads to DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This flaw may be triggered only by accepting untrusted user input to the vulnerable golang's library. The overall DoS attack vector depends directly on how the library's input is exposed by the consuming application, thus Red Hat rates impact as Moderate.

In Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes (RHACM) 2.5 version, the registration-operator, lighthouse-coredns, lighthouse-agent, gatekeeper-operator, and discovery-operator components are affected by this flaw, but the rest of the components are using an already patched version and are unaffected. For 2.4 and previous versions of Red Hat Advanced Cluster Management for Kubernetes (RHACM), most of the components are affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
See the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for this
release, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and
fully apply this asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.11/release_notes/ocp-4-11-release-notes.html

Details on how to access this content are available at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.11/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html

vulnerabilities.title: golang: out-of-bounds read in golang.org/x/text/language leads to DoS

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: A flaw was found in HAProxy's headers processing that causes HAProxy to drop important headers fields such as Connection, Content-length, Transfer-Encoding, and Host after having partially processed them. A maliciously crafted HTTP request could be used in an HTTP request smuggling attack to bypass filtering and detection by HAProxy.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: haproxy: request smuggling attack in HTTP/1 header parsing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat OpenStack Platform doesn't ship any haproxy code of its own and instead the openstack-haproxy-container consumes the `haproxy` RPM provided by RHEL.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
